title: Minister of Trade addresses Red Rice shortage, blames past policies
byline: Minister of Trade, Commerce and Food Security Wasantha Samarasinghe stated that the current shortage of Red Rice in the market emerged as a result of mismanagement by previous governments, while assuring the public that measures are being taken to address the situation.

title: Over 100 evacuated due to risk of Gal Oya river bunds breaching
byline: Over 100 individuals from more than 25 families in Senanayakapura and Samapura in Ampara, have been evacuated to safer locations due to the risk of the Gal Oya river bunds breaching, according to the Ampara District Secretary.

title: Sri Lanka hopes for more Chinese tourists: Deputy Minister
byline: “I have traveled almost all over China, and get impressed by the beauty of the diverse culture, food and friendly people. I also hope that more Chinese tourists will come to my country to experience Sri Lanka’s scenery and culture,” Ruwan Ranasinghe, Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism of Sri Lanka told Xinhua.

title: Thailand reiterates commitment to rescue Sri Lankan human trafficking victims in Myanmar
byline: The Ambassador and Permanent Representative of Sri Lanka to Thailand, Wijayanthi Edirisinghe has called on Chatchai Bangchuad, Secretary-General of the National Security Council (NSC) of Thailand recently.

title: President Dissanayake to meet Chinese counterpart tomorrow
byline: Sri Lanka’s President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, who is currently undertaking a 4-day state visit in China will meet the Chinese President Xi Jinping on Wednesday (14), the President’s Media Division (PMD) said.

title: Two Chinese nationals arrested at BIA with gems worth over Rs. 17 mln
byline: A group of officers of Sri Lanka Customs has apprehended a Chinese national father and his daughter over their attempt to smuggle a stock of gemstones out of the country.

title: Fairly heavy showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Department of Meteorology says showers or thundershowers will occur at times over most parts of the island and that cloudy skies are expected.

title: South Korea’s impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol arrested
byline: South Korean president Yoon Suk Yeol was reportedly arrested by the country’s Corruption Investigation Office for High Ranking officials, a first for a sitting South Korean leader.

title: Gunshots fired at a residence in Dodangoda
byline: A house located in the Wilpatha area of Dodangoda, Kalutara, was targeted in a shooting incident early this morning (15), according to Dodangoda Police.

title: 12-hour water cut in parts of Colombo
byline: A 12-hour water cut will be imposed in parts of Colombo on Thursday (Jan. 16), the National Water Supply & Drainage Board (NWSDB) announced.

title: UK anti-corruption minister resigns over ties to ousted Bangladesh PM
byline: The British minister responsible for financial services and fighting corruption resigned on Tuesday after weeks of questions over her financial ties to her aunt Sheikh Hasina, ousted last year as prime minister of Bangladesh.

title: Advisory issued for strong winds and rough seas
byline: The Department of Meteorology has issued an advisory for strong winds and rough seas in the sea areas off the coasts extending from Colombo to Kankasanthurai via Puttalam and Mannar.

title: 95% of fertilizer subsidy funds disbursed
byline: The Department of Agrarian Development states that 95% of the funds allocated for the fertilizer subsidy have been disbursed.

title: Over 2,000 dengue cases reported in Sri Lanka this year
byline: More than 2,000 dengue cases have been reported so far this year in Sri Lanka, according to the latest statistics released by the National Dengue Control Unit (NDCU).

title: Three including ‘Wele Suda’ and wife sentenced to 8 years RI
byline: The Colombo High Court today (15) pronounced the notorious drug kingpin Samantha Kumara alias ‘Wele Suda’, his wife and another woman guilty under the Money Laundering Act, for amassing illegal assets through drug dealings and sentenced each of them to 8 years of rigorous imprisonment.

title: Sri Lanka’s northern fishermen to hold talks with Tamil Nadu CM?
byline: A discussion is reportedly scheduled between the fishermen representatives from Sri Lanka’s Northern Province and the Chief Minister of India’s Tamil Nadu M.K. Stalin.

title: President pays tribute at Mao Zedong Mausoleum
byline: In response to an invitation from Chinese President Xi Jinping, Sri Lankan President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, who is currently on a state visit to China, visited the exhibition hall on the history of the Communist Party of China today (15).

title: Gal Oya river bunds still at risk of breaching
byline: A total of 135 individuals from 44 families in the villages of Senanayakepura, Samapura, and Suduwella in Ampara continue to remain in temporary shelters due to the risk of the Gal Oya river bunds breaching.

title: President Dissanayake meets Chinese President Xi Jinping
byline: Sri Lanka’s President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has met with the President of the People’s Republic of China Xi Jinping, a short while ago.

title: US regulator sues Elon Musk over 2022 purchase of deflated Twitter shares
byline: The United States Securities and Exchange Commission has sued Elon Musk, arguing that his purchase of Twitter shares in 2022 was carried out with violations, the regulator said in a filing published Tuesday.

title: Liquor shops, bars to remain closed on these dates
byline: The Excise Department has released an announcement specifying the 18 days in 2025 when liquor shops and bars across Sri Lanka will remain closed.

title: Approval granted to reduce CESS levy on cement
byline: The order presented by officials of the Ministry of Finance to reduce the prevailing CESS levy on cement has received approval from the Committee on Public Finance (COPF).

title: Court employee arrested with ‘ice’ in Wellampitiya
byline: A court employee has been arrested by the police while in possession of 10 grams and 800 milligrams of ‘ice’ drugs (crystal methamphetamine).

title: CoPF approves increase of ‘Aswesuma’ welfare benefits
byline: The Committee on Public Finance (CoPF) has approved the benefits to be provided to beneficiaries of the “Aswesuma” welfare programme by the end of this year, in consideration of the notification under Welfare Benefits Act, No. 24 of 2002.

title: Drake drops legal action over Kendrick Lamar song
byline: Drake has scrapped a legal case against Universal Music and Spotify, in which he accused the companies of conspiring to boost the streams of Kendrick Lamar’s diss track against him, Not Like Us.

title: SpaceX rocket launches private missions to Moon
byline: Two lunar landers built by private companies in the US and Japan have left Earth aboard a SpaceX rocket as part of a rideshare to the Moon.

title: Trump advisers concede Ukraine peace deal is months away
byline: Advisers to President-elect Donald Trump now concede that the Ukraine war will take months or even longer to resolve, a sharp reality check on his biggest foreign policy promise - to strike a peace deal on his first day in the White House.

title: China expresses readiness to collaborate with Sri Lanka towards a new era of development
byline: The People’s Republic of China has played a vital role in the social and economic development of Sri Lanka for decades, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said after meeting Chinese President Xi Jinping today.
